Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.io

Class Tokenizer

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.io.Tokenizer
public class Tokenizer extends Object
A tokenizer converts an input stream of text into a list of tokens, which are meaningful units of text annotated with where they occurred in the stream and any comments associated with them.

Tokens are usually delineated by whitespace, but a tokenizer can be initialized with a list of special symbols that will always be their own tokens regardless of whitespace. For example, if the open and close parenthesis characters are special symbols, the text "(word)" will be split into three tokens: "(", "word", and ")" despite their being no whitespace in the text.

A tokenizer removes comments from the input text, but the text of those comments is preserved in the Token.comment field. Comments are associated with the token immedately after the end of the comment. By default, a tokenizer recognizes C-style block and line comments, but this behavior can be changed by overriding the isComment(String) method.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • tokenize

      public ImmutableList<Token> tokenize(Reader reader) throws IOException
      Reads every character of input from a reader and converts them into a list of tokens.
      Parameters:
      reader - the text to be read
      Returns:
      a list of tokens
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs while reading from the reader

    • getInstruction

      protected Tokenizer.Instruction getInstruction(String token, String buffer)
      A tokenizer maintains two strings: the current token being built and a buffer. The tokenizer repeatedly calls this method which returns one of three instructions. Read means the tokenizer should remove the first token of the buffer and add it to the end of the token. Buffer means the tokenizer should read a new character of text onto the end of the buffer. Cut means the current token is complete, so the tokenizer will add it to the list and begin a new empty token.
      Parameters:
      token - the current token being build
      buffer - a buffer of characters read from the input stream
      Returns:
      the instruction the tokenizer should follow next

    • trimComment

      protected String trimComment(String string)
      Given a string that is a comment, this method removes the characters to signal this string is a comment, preserving only the content of the comment.
      Parameters:
      string - the comment string
      Returns:
      the content of the comment

    • isComment

      protected boolean isComment(String string)
      Checks whether a string is formatted as a comment.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string is a comment, false otherwise

    • ignore

      protected boolean ignore(String string)
      Checks whether a token should be ignored. By default, tokens composed entirely of whitespace are ignored.
      Parameters:
      string - the token string to check
      Returns:
      true if the token should be ignored, false otherwise
